title: I just recieved my discharge, when can I sell my car?
question: The car is actually my daughters but it is in my name she wants me to sell it but the attorney said I could not do anything because I filed for bankruptcy now that I,ve been discharged can I sell it?
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Debt,Lien,Debt discharge,Bankruptcy and debt,Residential property,Homeowners' association,Gift tax,Tax law
answers: I agree with Robert Suhajda's response. It depends on whether there is a loan on the vehicle. If not, you are free to sell it now. But if there was an unpaid loan on the vehicle, the lienholder has to be paid before you can change title.

1. If the car is owned free and clear you can sell it.
2. If the car is financed with outstanding debt existing after the bankruptcy, the lien holder has to be paid off before title can be changed.

Disclaimer
Although the above response is believed to be accurate, it should not be relied upon as any type of legal advice because the information provided is incomplete. It is intended to educate the reader and a more definite answer should be based on a consultation with a lawyer. No attorney client relation is formed with me without a written contract.

controller and auditor, to minimize homeowner association dues.

Did you list it in the bankruptcy? Was it properly exempted? If so, you can sell it.

Attorney Gerald Wolfe
